posts.content:
I guess if the enemies will just tank to someone not dealing them any damage, sure it will work, but it won't be much fun to play. With 35ab you're not going to hit much. Your AC is worse than a regular melee build with tumble (you traded 8 tumble for 4 RDD AC) and you have no armor skin. The great CONs are not worth the stat bumps once you get to 21/22, so you could get actual useful things like Armor Skin, Epic Prowess, Epic Energy Resistance, Great STR, etc.

I've never seen a build with 85 skill points before either...

http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 49289.html

Something like that might be a bit better for what you had in mind, 40 ab, 27/DR, full tumble AC bump, and still almost 700 hp along with a ton of skills.

http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 49432.html
or something like that if you want some elemental resistance.

Hi Dante,

Thanks for your input! I made some changes to the build, concerning the second build you posted. It has now some elemental resistance, armor skin, far better AC, less HP but still pretty high.
Would you recommend to do multiple alignment changes? I can take bard epic to dump remaining skill points in spellcraft and tumble. Say Bard 8, DwD 22.

posts.content:
Well if you're going to be allowed alignment changes may as well go all out.

Using your last post as a base, this is what I'd do if you insisted on playing those classes:

stop pumping CON after 22 and put those 4 pts in STR to end with 30 STR. Also, don't start with CON at 18 but 16 it will give you a ton of stat points to use places like INT, where you need it. Take the minimum perform needed for your bard song. Only take 8 RDD pre-epic and leave RDD 9 and 10 for epic. Those two things will add 3 AB and get you to 40. Assuming you can move alignments around at will, take a look at this build for its leveling http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 20964.html. I would add in more bard in epic so you can get full Tumble.

Even with AB 40 youre on the low end of acceptable for melee, so not sure using 2 feats for Power Attack/Cleave is a smart move. Also, great fortitude and perfect health seem like wasted feats unless you have a specific reason (well perfect health moreso than great fortitude, but you haven't said much about the environment). I'd try and work in Lingering Song, Curse Song, Knockdown for casters, or if you really want to make an AC stand (assuming you made some stat changes more like the link above and have 13 INT), expertise/Imp Expertise. You can also get another AB by not taking EER Cold 2, using that bonus feat slot for Armor skin, then taking 2 more Great Strength at 24 and 27.

Those are some recommendations I would make if you insist on playing this class mix.
